title: What type of leadership skills are significant for a scholarship candidate? - Quora
tags: College and University Scholarship and Fellowships

response.answer_text: A candidate for excellent opportunities should have demonstrated great leadership in extracurricular activities. Think of a reviewer of your application. He or she is no fool. If you join 15 clubs in your final year, that reviewer will see through that. Join a few activities in your first year, rise to the top of one or two of them. Become President or VP of the organization. Don’t stop there. Lead the organization to do something great for students, for the underprivileged, for society. Employers and graduate schools want doers. That’s a “WOW!” I wrote a letter for an exceptional student once, in which I used the phrase (borrowed from another colleague) which said that he left an indelible mark on the university. Lead transformational change; leave an indelible mark on your institution.

A scholarship recipient should hone the skill that got them there: communications. Leaders must possess substantial writing and oral skills. Time management and collaboration are also useful skills for scholarship recipients. Lastly, discipline is a very necessary skill for a scholarship recipient in order to maintain the requirements for the scholarship. I hope this helps. Dr. Burl
